HVB.F.summary: ÃSTRA Hannoversche Verkehrsbetriebe Aktiengesellschaft operates as a transport company in Germany. It operates a fleet of buses and rails. The company was founded in 1892 and is based in Hanover, Germany.

S4A.DE.summary: SMT Scharf AG plans, produces, sells, installs, and maintains machinery and equipment for the transportation of personnel, equipment, and material for underground mining and tunnel construction. The company operates through Coal Mining, Non-Coal Mining, and Tunnel segments. It offers monorail transport systems, including diesel-powered monorail locomotives, electrical monorail transport systems, and battery-powered monorail locomotives; and floor mounted rail systems comprising diesel powered rack and pinion locomotives and rope driven rail systems. The company also provides cable storage systems, such as cable and hose handling systems; battery machines, drill and bolt products, load and haul products, and utility products; and chairlift systems for mining personnel transport. Its products are primarily used in hard coal, gold, platinum, copper, nickel, hard rock, and salt mining activities. The company has operations in Germany, Russia and other CIS states, Poland, China, Africa, the United States, and internationally. SMT Scharf AG was founded in 1941 and is based in Hamm, Germany.

SLT.DE.summary: Schaltbau Holding AG, together with its subsidiaries, develops and supplies systems and components for the railway, automotive, and capital goods industries. It operates through three segments: Mobile Transportation Technology, Stationary Transportation Technology, and Components. The Mobile Transportation Technology segment offers door and boarding systems for buses, trains, and commercial vehicles, as well as interior fittings for rolling stock; systems fitted with safety technology and boarding equipment for trams, metros, suburban and regional trains, and high-speed intercity trains; and sanitary systems, as well as related installation, commissioning, maintenance, and after-sales services. The Stationary Transportation Technology segment offers computer-controlled railway crossing safety technologies, axle counter systems, and shunting and signal technologies to infrastructure operators, including private, company, and port railway systems. The Components segment develops, manufactures, and sells connectors, snap-action switches, DC contactors, and driver's cab equipment for the railway and industrial sectors. The company sells its products under the Schaltbau, Bode, Pintsch, and SBRS brand names. It operates in Germany, other European countries, China, Hong Kong, North America, and internationally. Schaltbau Holding AG was founded in 1929 and is based in Munich, Germany.

VOS.DE.summary: Vossloh AG manufactures and markets rail infrastructure products and services worldwide. It operates in three divisions: Core Components, Customized Modules, and Lifecycle Solutions. The Core Components division develops, produces, and markets rail fastening systems for light-rail, heavy-haul, and high-speed lines, as well as urban transport. This division also manufactures concrete ties, switch ties, and concrete elements for slab tracks and level crossing systems. The Customized Modules division manufactures, installs, and maintains switches and crossings, as well as control and monitoring systems for light-rail and high-speed applications. The Lifecycle Solutions division engages in rail trading, long-rail unloading at construction sites, welding new rails, reconditioning old rails, on-site welding, rail replacement, rail grinding/milling, rail inspection, and construction site supervision activities. This division also organizes and monitors rail shipments to construction sites. The company was founded in 1883 and is based in Werdohl, Germany.

WID.F.summary: Windhoff Bahn- und Anlagentechnik GmbH designs, manufactures, and supplies railway systems and equipment for railway depots and commuter train operators. The company offers multi-purpose wagons for modular superstructures; base vehicles; multi-purpose trucks; multi-purpose vehicles (four-axle), and multi-purpose vehicles (two-axle) for modular superstructures. It also provides complex lifting plants, work platforms, turntables, bogie measuring stands, bogie drops, wheelset scales, wheelset turning units, wheelset drops, and traversers, as well as planning and project management for new projects and refurbishing programs. The company's products are used for construction and maintenance of rail tracks, overhead catenary systems, and freight forwarding, as well as for fire-fighting and rescue services. It serves a range of rail vehicles and accessories for main lines operators, sidings, commuter companies, and metros worldwide. Windhoff Bahn- und Anlagentechnik GmbH was formerly known as Rheiner Maschinenfabrik Windhoff, Aktiengesellschaft. The company was founded in 1889 and is based in Rheine, Germany. As of March 4, 2002, Windhoff Bahn- und Anlagentechnik GmbH operates as a subsidiary of GeorgsmarienhÃ¼tte Holding GmbH.
